definitions.definition: A substance that, in solution or when molten , ionizes and conducts electricity .
A solution containing such substances, which therefore also conducts electricity.
examples: Some modern lead-acid batteries are sealed because they never need to have any electrolyte added during their service life.

definitions.definition: Any of the various ions in such a solution , or ( metonymically ) their concentration therein.

subdefinitions.definition: Any of the various biometal ions (such as sodium or chloride ) that regulate the electric charge on cells and the flow of water across their membranes , or ( metonymically ) such an ion's concentration in a bodily fluid , usually and especially blood , blood serum , or urine .
examples: Lab tests to consider under these circumstances include serum electrolytes , serum glucose, and urine protein.

main_definition: ( chemistry ) A substance that, in solution or when molten , ionizes and conducts electricity .
secondary_definitions: ( chemistry ) A solution containing such substances, which therefore also conducts electricity.
( chemistry , often ) Any of the various ions in such a solution , or ( metonymically ) their concentration therein.
